title: [FEATURE] Generic way of rendering and interacting with different types of content
body:
# Introduction and use case
This feature request is a continuation of https://github.com/mono/SkiaSharp/issues/1462.
I would like to create a "Composition control" that allows users to make a composition of different layers that are rendered on top of each other:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3463496/91884176-e0877280-ec85-11ea-8331-3a8e0ff75f3a.png)

Suggested interaction:
- one item can be added per layer
- an item can be text, a bitmap or a vector image
- the user can rotate, pan or scale the item in the active layer using touch
- the user can pan the item in the active layer using mouse / pen
- on the left, a list of layers is shown
- the user can select the active layer in the list on the left

For this, it would be helpful if there was a generalized way to render those different types and interact with them (scale/pan/rotate).

What did I investigate:
- we looked at generalization of "renderables" (text/vector/bitmap) in https://github.com/mono/SkiaSharp/issues/1462
- I found [`TouchManipulationBitmap`](https://github.com/xamarin/xamarin-forms-samples/blob/master/SkiaSharpForms/Demos/Demos/SkiaSharpFormsDemos/Transforms/TouchManipulationBitmap.cs) which works for bitmaps, but not for text / paths
- I built a prototype of the control at https://github.com/hansmbakker/SkiaSharpPoc
